conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each entry point and how it interacts with the baffles.
Liquid flows from A, which is at the top left.
First baffle from A is orange and angled downward to the right.
Liquid from A will be directed downward and to the right by the first baffle.
Second baffle from A is gray and angled downward to the left.
Liquid from A will be directed further to the right and downward.
Liquid from A will eventually flow into container F.
Liquid flows from B, which is at the top center.
First baffle from B is green and angled downward to the right.
Liquid from B will be directed downward and to the right by the first baffle.
Second baffle from B is blue and angled downward to the left.
Liquid from B will be directed further to the right and downward.
Liquid from B will eventually flow into container F.
Liquid flows from C, which is at the top right.
First baffle from C is yellow and angled downward to the left.
Liquid from C will be directed downward and to the left by the first baffle.
Second baffle from C is red and angled downward to the right.
Liquid from C will be directed further to the left and downward.
Liquid from C will eventually flow into container E.
Liquid flows from D, which is at the top right.
First baffle from D is blue and angled downward to the left.
Liquid from D will be directed downward and to the left by the first baffle.
Second baffle from D is red and angled downward to the right.
Liquid from D will be directed further to the left and downward.
Liquid from D will eventually flow into container E.
